intro: Saurauia tambensis, commonly known as the Tumbes cactus, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Ecuador and Peru. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh coastal conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and they bloom in the spring. Saurauia tambensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and shelter for small animals.
